name: Timbuktu Manuscripts Library
description: A historical library housing thousands of ancient manuscripts on various subjects, reflecting the rich history of Timbuktu.

name: Djinguereber Mosque
description: One of the most famous mosques in Timbuktu, built in 1327 using mud and wood, serving as a center for Islamic scholarship.

name: Timbuktu Market
description: A vibrant market where locals trade goods like spices, textiles, and handmade crafts.

name: Ahmed Baba Institute
description: A research center dedicated to preserving and studying ancient manuscripts from West Africa.

name: Sankore University
description: An ancient Islamic university that was a major center of learning during the Mali Empire.

name: Timbuktu Desert Expeditions
description: Experience the breathtaking Sahara Desert with guided camel tours and camping under the stars.

name: Festival au Désert
description: A famous music festival celebrating Tuareg and West African culture, featuring traditional and modern performances.

name: Bouctou Village
description: A small traditional village that showcases the lifestyle and culture of the Tuareg people.
